props.value:
You can test it with the user info in https://dummyjson.com/users  
Userinfo used to test the non-admin user: username:dpettegre6 password: YVmhktgYVS

## Intro
We need to do the following steps to make sure the a user must login to visit your homepage or other pages
1. Successfully login
2. Use the token to set the global data and redirect to homepage
3. trigger token_check action to check whether the token is available  
3.1 if available, enter the homepage  
3.2 if not available, redirect to login page
4. Set the check_token action to run periodically to check whether the token is still available. 

## How to
### Method 1: Trigger script to finish it
#### Step 1
Set the front-end and config the login action

#### Step 2
Add a globalData named `token` to store the token.

#### Step 4
Add a check_token_expired action to check whether the token is available

#### Step 6
Set the action to run when the homepage loading which is used to avoid visiting homepage without login.

#### Step 7
Set the action to run periodically. When you set a expired time(or some expired logic ) to the token and want the user log out when the token state changed, you can use this feature to check the token state periodically.

### Method 2: Not Run Script (Check this demo: https://builder.illacloud.com/illacloud_demo/deploy/app/ILAex4p1C7FD)
We have added all the functions in Method 1 to the event handler and you can add multiple event handlers to one component or one action.   
  And you can use change Run Script to others like trigger action, set router, set global data... to set the event handlers when the login button is clicked or the action runs successful.
